item.title: Post-Pandemic Work Life: Going Into Work Once Per Week
item.description: As the Covid-19 pandemic continues, working from home (“WFH”) has become one of the most talked about changes for those of us who can do it. WFH is not a fundamentally new concept. But before March 2020, it was seen as a perk, something weird Silicon Valley companies let their employees do every once in a while. Now, it’s become a necessity. Everyone that isn’t an essential worker is working from home.

item.title: Ruby Assignments in Conditional Expressions
item.description: For around two and a half years, I had been working in a Python 2.x environment at my old job . Since switching companies, Ruby and Rails has replaced Python and Flask. At first glance, the languages don’t seem super different, but there are definitely common Ruby idioms that I needed to learn. While adding a new feature, I came across code that looked like this: if (variable = some_func()) do_something(variable) end Intuitively, I guessed this meant “if some_func() returns something, do_something with it.

item.title: Hello World!
item.description: Hi everyone, this is my personal website. This will hopefully become the center of my internet presence. I will be writing about things I’ve learned, which could be as simple as summaries, to more complex and “original” things like my thoughts and reflections. There will hopefully be a bookshelf / book summaries section, where I summarize and review books. I will probably write about coding related stuff as well, but I’m not yet sure if it should have its own section.

item.title: Hi!
item.description: I’m Julien Chien, nice to meet you! Currently based in San Francisco, where I work at a startup. Previously, I’ve lived and studied in Shanghai and the Los Angeles area. I am passionate about tech, economics, running, football (soccer), communities & how they work, urbanism & cities, and internet phenomena. Drop me a line at hello@julienchien.com or on Twitter !
